    • Method Detail

      • getLocales

        public static void getLocales()
        This routine scans for available locales on the Java system, then tries to match these with the available localization files for the Genji application, based on the ApplicationResources files. Only these locales are being offered to the user.
        If there is no support within Java, but the locale is available as a resource file, still add this locale.

      • addLanguage

        public static void addLanguage(java.lang.String localeStr)

      • getPossibleLocales

        public static java.util.List<LabelValueBean> getPossibleLocales()
        Returns:
        Returns the available locales in string format, including country code, like en_US. There is also a "Browser" entry in this list, in case the user wants to control the preferred language settings via the browser.

      • getAvailableLocales

        public static java.util.List<LabelValueBean> getAvailableLocales()
        Returns:
        Returns the available locales in string format, including country code only when there is a .

      • getJavaLanguages

        public static java.util.List<LabelValueBean> getJavaLanguages()
        returns the available languages in java
        Returns:

      • getPropertiesLocales

        public static java.util.List<java.util.Locale> getPropertiesLocales()

      • getExistingLocale

        public static java.util.Locale getExistingLocale(java.util.Locale locale)
        Checks if the locale preferred by the user can actually be provided. If not, the next best match is taken, for example by removing the variant. In the worst case, the system default locale is taken, if it exists, or the standard locale (English).
        Parameters:
        locale - desired by the user
        Returns:
        a best match existing locale

      • getExistingLocale

        public static java.util.Locale getExistingLocale(java.util.Enumeration<java.util.Locale> locales)
        Retrieve the preferred existing locale for this user.
        Parameters:
        locales - - the preferred locales as sent by the browser
        Returns:
        the first preferred existing locale out of this list, or the system default if none exists

      • getExistingOnlineHelpLanguageCode

        public static java.lang.String getExistingOnlineHelpLanguageCode(java.util.Locale locale)
        Checks if the locale for the online help preferred by the user can actually be provided. If not found, the standard online help locale (English) is provided.
        Parameters:
        locale - online help locale desired by the user
        Returns:
        a best match existing online help locale

      • getLocaleFromString

        public static java.util.Locale getLocaleFromString(java.lang.String loc)
        Parameters:
        loc - the locale in toString format (e.g. de_DE_BA)
        Returns:
        a locale object for this locale

      • getExistingExtJSLocale

        public static java.lang.String getExistingExtJSLocale(java.util.Locale locale)
        Return a matching locale suffix for the ExtJS language files.
        Parameters:
        locale -
        Returns:
